reviews.review_msg: Solid professor.  Pleasant to deal with and very willing to help outside of class.  Work load was a bit high, but clear criteria made it manageable.  Only real complaint I have is the mandatory attendance, which meant I lost marks for not warming a lecture hall seat.  Still did fine overall.

Very friendly professor. Seemingly always willing to give advice and help if you need it. Marking is lenient, if you follow the rubric and do what's asked you'll do well in his courses. On the flipside, there's a lot of writing and busywork in 405W (but that's more an issue with the course, not how Mike teaches it).

Craig is the master of rambling for hours while saying nothing. Reads off the slides when slides are made for him, otherwise rambles over C/C++ files instead. You need to self-teach in any of his classes, and since this is capstone, that means everything he says in lecture can be disregarded and you should only focus on the project and documents.
